result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Barron

Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

TURN OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR PLACEMENT. UPON PLACEMENT BAIL IS TO CONVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND WITH TURNOVER JUSTICEPOINT.   As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Barron appeared by video means with Attorney.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT ONE, FOUR AND FIVE; The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Drug Treatment Court Contract
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire & Addendum
Received and Filed.

Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court of the defendant's pending felony matter in branch 25 and a potential global offer. Defense requests a status conference. 
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store. Court advised defendant that failure to comply may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
